17629176.trustfund:
TF022593-PHRD-HEALTH AND FAMILY PROJECT II,TF022223-CANADIAN CTF FOR SUSTAINABLE DEV.-POP.,TF032885-SRI LANKA - HEALTH AND
            POPULATION II,TF032891-SRI LANKA - HEALTH,TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF031940-SRI LANKA - HEALTH & FAMILY PLANNING

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's overall outcome and
            achievement is rated satisfactory. Sustainability of the
            project is likely. Overall, the World Bank's
            performance was satisfactory. Borrower performance is rated
            satisfactory because with strong Borrower efforts during the
            second implementation phase, the project achieved most of
            its objectives. Several lessons were learned from this
            project: For successful implementation, new directions such
            as in the NCD component, and program reorientation as in the
            nutrition component, require extensive consultations and a
            broad consensus among the key stakeholders. Consultation
            with the key implementation staff is necessary. Procurement
            is often critical to the success of HNP projects.
            Complementarities and synergies among vertical programs
            should be identified and exploited. A responsive field
            presence is necessary. Attention to administrative issues is
            needed at the start. PMUs that lack strong support from the
            ministry leadership, have limited management effectiveness.
            Previous lessons should be internalized into project design.
            Financial management capacity is a prerequisite. Contracting
            for services requires special skills and shifts in the
            institutional culture. Traditional public sector culture is
            not conducive to working with nongovernmental organizations.
            Proper monitoring indicators are essential. Restructure as
            needed when problems arise.

5081158.trustfund:
TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF032891-SRI LANKA - HEALTH,TF022223-CANADIAN CTF FOR SUSTAINABLE DEV.-POP.,TF031940-SRI LANKA - HEALTH & FAMILY PLANNING,TF022593-PHRD-HEALTH AND FAMILY PROJECT II,TF032885-SRI LANKA - HEALTH AND
            POPULATION II

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Health Services
            Project for Sri Lanka are to strengthen the
            Government's ability to address: a) remaining major
            public health problems (malaria, malnutrition and HIV/AIDS);
            b) new challenges raised by the epidemiological transition
            and the increasing importance of non-communicable diseases
            of adults; and c) key health policy and financing issues. To
            achieve these objectives the project will comprise the
            following components: a) malaria component; b) Sexually
            Transmitted Disease (STD)/AIDS component; c) nutrition
            component; d) non-communicable diseases; e) program support
            component, which contains three subcomponents: health
            policy, management information systems and health education.
